physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr. A was in excellent health until 1960, when he developed diabetes mellitus, hypertension, and type V hyperlipoproteinemia. By 1974, his medical problems progressed to the point of preventing attendance at meetings and supervision at construction sites. He developed retinopathy, peripheral neuropathy, and depressed affect by 1975.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Since the onset of nightmares in 1976, Mr. A's health continued to deteriorate. He suffered a small unilateral occipital lobe infarct in 1978, a myocardial infarction in 1979, another myocardial infarction in 1981 with severe arrhythmias, and later developed leg ulcers and cellulitis in 1983.
